page.title: 04RUISLIP GREAT BARN/COW BYRE
page.content: Ruislip has listed buildings around the library area at the bottom of the High Street.There are the Great Barn, Little Barn,Manor Farm in the Manor Farm leisure complex.The Great Barn was built 1255 and is about 10m wide and 40m long.It is made out of timber from Ruislip Woods and is a local land mark.The Great Barn is used for exhibitions,there are 2 art exhibi- tions a year.It's used for Guide and Scout jumble sales,also the barn and the area around it are used for dog training. The library ran a Saturday market in the Great Barn to raise funds for putting in some lighting. The cow byre is no longer a listed building because it has been rebuilt after the original was burnt down. It is used for regular exhibitions and local events.
